key_points: Dolph Lundgren reflects on Brandon Lee's death and relates it to the recent 'Rust' shooting.
Lundgren discussed the incident and his thoughts with Fox News.
Brandon Lee, son of Bruce Lee, died on the set of 'The Crow' in 1993 due to an accidental shooting.
Lee and Lundgren co-starred in the 1991 film 'Showdown in Little Tokyo'.
The recent 'Rust' shooting involved actor Alec Baldwin accidentally shooting cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, leading to her death.
Lundgren calls for serious firearm handling on set, questioning how live ammo was present on the 'Rust' set.
Shannon Lee, Brandon Lee's sister, advocates for mandatory gun safety training for actors.
Shannon Lee expressed sympathy for both Alec Baldwin and Michael Massee, emphasizing the tragedy of the situation for everyone involved.
The Lee family calls for Brandon's death to be the last of its kind due to on-set accidents.
Dolph Lundgren emphasizes the responsibility and seriousness required when handling firearms on movie sets.
